result.execSummary:
The defendant Maurice D Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation may be discharged early if deemed appropriate by the agent.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees.  $200 DNA surcharge assessed.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.

Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Defendant may not have any alcohol in or on the premises of home.  Defendant may not go into any establishments that sell alcohol except for restaurants and grocery stores.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including alcohol and drug counseling. If Deft successfully completes the drug treatment program in Milwaukee County, then the department should give serious consideration to deeming that as satisfying this condition, then the court will not require that this be done. If the department feels that some official aftercare or follow up treatment is necessary, then its w/in their discretion to require that. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Maurice D Williams
Current: 927 Marquette St Apt 2, Mount Pleasant, WI 53404 United States  (Effective: 11-16-2016)
Prior: 5616 Castle Ct # 103, Racine, WI 53405
Per RASO - mandatory jail time has been served
DOC-Notice of Case Status change - revoked - sentenced to co. jail.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Maurice D Williams in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Parties are requesting a change of plea date.
BTC: Date set.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on March 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 5, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim, CM (person, property, residence or family).   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Maurice D Williams in court with attorney Ahmed Jenkins.  Defendant Maurice D Williams in custody.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
